s.text: "We will not be relying on the good will of a rogue state to allow inspectors onto its territory," the three leaders write.

A NYT investigation of Colin Powell's charity, America's Promise, alleges that it has undefined goals, does not meet its own deadlines, takes credit for corporate contributions and community projects with which it is only peripherally involved, and does not reveal how or how much it pays its top officers, as charities traditionally do.

Rejection would give great encouragement to proliferators.
Benefits are not limited to those who sued: Any one of the six million Americans who took the drug can submit claims, and there is no statute of limitations.

The legislation was supported by the labor and consumer lobbies as well as the American Medical Association, and fought by insurance and business groups, who argued it would enrich trial lawyers and cause employers to drop medical benefits for workers.
